video.title: Deflation Despite Increases in Money Supply
video.description: How you can have deflation even if the money supply increases.

problemSets.question: If the money supply were to increase dramatically, will inflation increase as a byproduct?

choices.answer: Inflation will definitely increase drastically because there’s more money available to spend.
If prices don’t increase and purchasing power doesn’t decrease, effectively inflation will not increase. (This can happen if, for example, people hoard money).
There will be no effect on inflation.

links.text: Keep learning! How much currency is in circulation?
links.url_text: Federal Reserve Currency in Circulation Data
